Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Michael255093
Reviews.Content: The good: - 49 Euro per night for a single room (39 Euro if you book far enough ahead) - clean room and recently upgraded bathrooms - comfortable beds - friendly, helpful, English-speaking staff - 10 minutes leisurely stroll to Kurfurstendamm and the eateries and shopping nearby The bad: - basic rooms are a little cramped - charges for wi-fi (2 Euro per hour) - elevators are small and it is easier to use stairs Despite the few minor bad points, this is a great budget hotel and I'd happily stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Motel”
Reviews.Author: Jeff_Cheong
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights and found it to be great value for money. We arrived into Berlin via train and took a cab from Berlin hbf to the hotel for around €15~ (can't remember exactly how much). We managed to check in late at around 11pm. My first impression of the place was the twists and turns of corridors to find my room. Glad to have found the room clean and tidy - definitely a positive after a 10hour train ride! The hotel has bicycle rental for around €12 for 24 hours and bfast for €7. Staff was helpful with directions and lots of local shops for fruits, bread, etc and laundramat wasn't too far away. Close to some great restaurants and metro as well. Would recommend for future stays!

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE: Extremly dirty, understaffed cleaners and the employee seemed not to care about anything - Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: pharaoh-advisor
Reviews.Content: Okay... Where shall I start. When we arrived we could choose to take the staiers or the elevator. Usaully we have never been afraid of elevatiors. BUT... this one moved very very slowly and made strange sounds and additionally we had to walk one stairway anyway with our luggage beacuse it just stopped every second floor. After that we had a very long walk to our room. - Finally we opened our door into our room and it was dirty and smelled very bad. There was a lot of dust everywhere. I don't think that someone had been dusting our room beacuse of the dust on the tabel and on the nightstands. So I had to go all the way downstairs again and ask if they could clean the room. When we some hours later got back into our room I couldn't see any difference at all so I unfurtunaly had to clean it myself. - The hotel is very dark and smelly inside even though it looks fine from the outside. - You have to pay 2 euros pr. hour to get internet. - One day our room was not cleaned before 5 pm and we had been out for the whole day so I just asked for new towels so they didn't clean the room that day. Usally they cleaned our room at 3 pm. The cleaner seemed EXTREMLY stressed and was almost running between the rooms looking like they really tryied but the time could not reach. - For two days we didn't have any soap because they didn't refill when they cleaned the roonm. Acutally I'll not but the blame on the cleaners beacuse I really think they should hire more employee. Poor woman hope she will find a better job! All in all... Terrible and very unfrindly room - you will definitely find SOMETHING better than this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: sunflower1111
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 1 night. Hotel is simple but nice. Very good location. Bus station for a bus to the airport is 10 min walking from hotel. Shoping street is 5 min walking from hotel. I booked single room. It was extrimely small. When I booked room and looked at the picture on the site it was a little bit different. So I would advice for solo travelers to check which kind of room is booked for them as they have too types of single rooms. What I didn`t like is that hotel doesn`t have first aid kit. I hirted my foot in canteen and my foot was bleeding. I went to reception to ask for some medicine and they tald they don`t have anything just plaster. So I had to go back to my room and just wash my foot :-( Breackfast was fine, canteen was nice and clean. Staff was polite.

Reviews.Title: “Quite, cheap but... not clean enough!”
Reviews.Author: Debora M
Reviews.Content: This cosy and not expensive hotel is situaded in a nice and calm Berlin area, near the Metro station (Augsburg Str.). The Schaperstr., plenty of trees, is a very peaceful street. The staff is efficient and practical. But the linen (mainly the pillows) should have more attention of the owners because this is not a very pleasant card presentation. This was the first hotel where I have been in the last 15 years, where I had to buy myself a pillow in a store in the nearby (Ku-damm). Imagine why!

Reviews.Title: “Good facilities, but a little bit far from down town”
Reviews.Author: spinjosovsky
Reviews.Content: The Hotel facilities are excellent, everthing looked clean and proper. The hotel price is amazing, really cheap in a really good hotel is really rare. Only negative point is the distance to downtown, although there is a metro station 200 m from the hotel, you make like 25 min to arrive to alexanderplatz, for example; and the breakfast!!! way to much expensive for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: mannks
Reviews.Content: Very clean room, simple and efficient. No mini bar, but drinks are available at reception. Buy a parking permit at the front desk for 8 Euros. Nice brakfast.fantastic location just 2 blocks from Kurfuersten Damm. Don't waste your money on fee for wi-fi, cause a Starbucks is 2 blocks away. Very clos to subway....excellent value for Berlin

Reviews.Title: “One word... AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Lomo21
Reviews.Content: Oh my god, where to start? This hotel is more than we ever expected from a hotel in this price range! The room was really comfortable, incredibly spacious and had a very impressive view. It is in a good location in terms of restaurants, shops, etc. However, if the main purpose of your visit is to see the main attractions (e.g. reichstag, brandenburg tor), then bear in mind that it is approximately an hour's walk away. Having said this, the zoo is a few minutes walk up the road and from here you can get on a range of tour buses which will take you around the city for about 8 euros per person.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure for budget travellers!”
Reviews.Author: jmdeg1
Reviews.Content: We were very pleasantly surprised by this very clean and stylish hotel. We had been accustomed to paying more than twice the price for something half as impressive. We can't recommend this place enough as a great value, quality hotel. We did not stay for breakfast - but everything else was more than satisfactory. Huge bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “A very good location for a budget priced hotel”
Reviews.Author: Patgriffin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a quiet street but only a few minutes walk from the Kurfurstendamm and Tauentzienstrasse shopping area. The nearest U Bahn station is less than 100yds away. The reception is manned 24hours/day by extremely friendly and helpful staff. I chose the basic single room, but this was sufficient if all you need is somewhere to sleep. The room was clean, tidy, warm, and the bed was comfortable. Breakfast is served in a modern comfortable cafe, and there was a large range of hot and cold items available on the large buffet - breads, jams, cold meats, cereals, yoghurts, eggs, a variety of teas and plenty of excellent coffee. A better value, budget priced hotel, in such a central location would I am sure be difficult to find,

Reviews.Title: “very comfy, nice, spacious, quiet, location is fine too”
Reviews.Author: CamacukJ
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights. Very comfortable room (23 sqm + 7sq m dressing area with wardrobe + 6sq m bathroom) for little money possibly 50GBP or so. breakfast was 'stylish' but the quality was not super amazing. room was very stylish, with sofa and large double bed. nice old house with modern/renovated rooms. a tube station is close by but the tube line is not majorly convenient for sightseeing so one always needs to change lines. 7 min walk to Ku'damm. No majorly exciting restaurants/bars around. very quiet and friendly area. I'd definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for traveller on a budget”
Reviews.Author: philip861
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Metropolitan for five nights on a budget trip to Berlin and I would not hesitate to recommend it for such a visit. It is located close to a S-Bahn station- part of Berlin's great rail system- and so is within easy reach of the city's main attractions. The room I stayed in was perfectly functional, although there was no air conditioning (which was a bit of a problem in 30 degree temperatures) and the walls were quite thin, which would not suit light sleepers. All in all, however, this room suited me perfectly for the trip I was on.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: mretzloff
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms in this hotel. I choose this hotel because the price of stay was low and its location was good. The KaDeWe, Berlin's premier mall, is only a ten minute walk from the hotel. Another ten minutes brings you to the Zoologischer Garten, where you will find a souvenir shop, a McDonald's, a bakery, and a Dunkin' Donuts, as well as U-Bahn and S-Bahn stations. The location is good, especially for the cost of the hotel. I had the bad luck of staying here as a heat wave passed over Berlin. With a third and fifth floor room, neither with air conditioning, this was pretty hard on my family. The hotel did provide fans, but this did not really helped. I got the feeling that the design of the hotel did not allow heat to escape it very well. It was often much cooler outside than inside. The design of the hotel was decent at best. The hotel is a converted apartment, so finding your room is like going through a maze. I was lucky to have a room at the end of the hotel, but if you get one in the middle or at the beginning, where everyone walks by, you are out of luck. The service was good and the breakfast expensive at €7.50. Your best bet for breakfast is to walk to Dunkin' Donuts or the bakery. The cleanliness was passable. I found several long hairs in the sink and shower, none of which were mine or my family member's. On the beds you could feel the springs, and my mother's actually broke. The furniture is a little flimsy too. The table in my room almost lost both legs, just because I moved it slightly. You have to pay for parking and Internet. If I go back to Berlin, I will look for a different hotel. I hear that there are better for only a little bit more money. The windows barely shut, so I would avoid this hotel during the winter at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “needs non-smoker rooms”
Reviews.Author: stanlund
Reviews.Content: Pro: The hotel is in the quiet neighborhood close to the subway stations and the shopping district. We had a big room and cleaning stuff is really trying to keep it good condition. The receptionists are also nice and friendly. Con: Would be a big plus if they had designated non-smoker rooms – our room was smelly on arrival and we had to leave windows open. In that case, the nearby road contributed with some noise. The breakfast has the variety but hardly worth 7.5 euro. And sorry, but the elevator is not for a faint-hearted as it sagged an inch before starting the movement.

Reviews.Title: “we suggest it for his convenience!”
Reviews.Author: CristinaPneum
Reviews.Content: I and my husband lodged at the Metropolitan hansa Hotel in Berlin for 2 nights in February 2010 and we felt very well in this hotel. It is located near to most popular boulevard Kurfurstendamm and the department store KaDeWe (about 8-10 minute on foot). In the vicinity there wasn’t shop or market, but the U-bahn Augsburger was at only 4 minutes on foot. We booked online and we asked for a double room in an high floor, so they got us a comfortable double room (505 at the fourth flat); it was very nice, spacious, with a modern but essential furniture, a big bed and soft blankets. The only two lacks were the elevator (not very safe…) and the heating (in the room there was only a radiator that the first evening didn’t work, so the staff got us a fan…) We didn’t have breakfast. The staff was little talkative. There was a small hall and an old lift. The internet service was in the hall for pay. The hotel is a good solution for staying in Berlin in a quiet area and a nice hotel with a good price (we payed only 108 euro for 2 nights!). Especially we suggest it for his convenience! We will come there again!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a quiet area but definately not for light sleepers”
Reviews.Author: outrun78
Reviews.Content: Mmmm. I guess you get what you pay for here. Booked what i thought was a fantastic public rate of around £130 for 5 nights and was willing to give this a try, but alas after one night I had to check out simply becuase sleep was nigh on impossible and it doesnt matter which room you get put in. The hotel suffers from a terrible conversion job, its an amalgamation of two buildings, which leads to the confusion of trying to find your room it this is numbered between 09-17 on most floors. Be prepared to go via numerous corridors to find your room. Was allocated room 208 which was at the end of one building but right next to a heavy door to get to other rooms. Result was every time that someone from other rooms entered or exited their rooms they had to pass by mine and slam the door, so this was constant at all hours resulting in very disturbed sleep. Walls are paper thin, the corridors have no soundproofing or underlay on the carpets so passing traffic could be heard at all hours. Reception when we arrived and decided to check out was not manned, so again no good first impression. Beds were springy and worn, pillows were useless and general cleanliness was not that high (lots of dust in rooms). Bathroom was tiny, the shower would definately not suit any person who was is a size 14 or 34 inch waist or higher as they will have trouble trying to get into the bathroom. Windows didn't close properly and as it was in the minus 10 range it means you need the heating on all the time. Have to agree with other reviewers on here who say you can get much much better in Berlin for not much more. Great i think if you are used to hostel dormitories but not for seasoned hotel guests. Avoid!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Em85Sydney
Reviews.Content: For my first trip to Berlin, I was very happy with this hotel. A little tricky finding the room in the middle of the night - the hotel is a bit of a maze - but once we were there it was excellent. Spacious room, lovely balcony, large bathroom, LCD tv. The room was quiet, clean and well heated. The hotel was easy to get to from the airport and close to buses, subway etc. It met all the needs I had for my stay and would happily go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: juhofinn
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 5 nights near Christmas time...And was pleased with all aspects of the hotel, it was very easy to get from TXL to about a block away with bus+U-bahn..the staff were helpfull,room was tidy and bathroom was clean..beds were very comfortable...breakfast was reasonably priced(7.50 euro) and had scrambled and boiled eggs along with the normal german meats cheeses and rolls..internet in the lobby 2 euro or an hour...close to K-damm and Zoo a few minutes walk.... I would stay again for sure!! juho

Reviews.Title: “A budget, boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: forwarddeployed
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for one night, before moving on to meet some friends in Vienna. . . The hotel is located on a quiet side street, but is very close to Kurfurstendamm and local shopping. . . The staff allowed me to do an early check-in and were very friendly and helpful. The elevator was a little on the small side, but got me up to my room, which was on the 4th floor of the hotel. The room was a single, but had a double bed and ran about $75, which was very inexpensive for the area. The room itself was spartan but was relatively quiet. The only problem I had was the shower area of the bathroom, which was basically a pedestal shower basin, which tended to allow water to splash out and soak the floor. . . Outside of that, the room was more than adequate, if not a basic, economy room.

Reviews.Title: “Fine budget hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: 1globetrotterSweden
Reviews.Content: A really fine little budget hotel on Schapperstrasse in a great area of Berlin. I Stayed there for three nights and found it really wonderful. My room wre small but clean and with LCD-Tv with international stations. Great staff. If you want to live cheap I could recommend this hotel in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very good hotel - with no frills.”
Reviews.Author: Ladymann
Reviews.Content: There's an attempt at stylishness here, but ultimately its a business hotel at its best offering good clean spacious rooms, adequate bathroom, heating and a wonderful buffet breakfast at the Bistro run by a wonderful chap next door. The hotel is basic but has pay as you go WiFi and many good TV channels. Ideal for business travellers who want no frills in a quiet area that's only a few stops from Potsdamer Plz etc. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff but needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: spidersam
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here for three nights in late January 2009. Overall we were quite satisfied with what we got, but we did have a couple of issues. On our first morning we had breakfast at the buffet. What we do when we travel is have a big breakfast at the hotel so we can save money on the lunch and use it for something more interesting. Both of us are quite husky. Anyway, when the waiter came to collect our food, he found it fit (pun intended) to say, in German: “Tell me this isn’t all for you? The thin people!” Unfortunately for him he was unaware that my partner speaks German – even though he’d spoken German to him 15 minutes previously! We went straight to reception to complain and we got a personal apology from both the lady in reception and the hotel manager plus free breakfast for the rest of our stay, which we thought was fair enough. However, we didn’t go back to see our new friend. When we walked past the restaurant the next two mornings we saw no one inside, so we wondered whether he had been rude to more people. Another problem we had is that our room was very dusty. Not a single time throughout our stay did anyone dust the furniture, and the dust was clearly visible on the desk and the bedside tables. Both my partner and I are allergic to dust, so this was no good for us. There were also cobwebs in the ceiling. We also ran out of shampoo in our last day, meaning that it had not been replaced from even before our arrival. The bathroom itself was pretty clean though. Other than that, the hotel is good value, and the staff in reception was always nice and helpful. The wireless Internet was not that expensive and it was really fast and reliable too. The location was also very convenient, just a short walk from the underground. I would stay here again but I hope next time the place is less dusty and our friend the waiter is less sulky.

Reviews.Title: “so-so”
Reviews.Author: kekocowan
Reviews.Content: Berlin was unusually hot for this time of year, we may have felt better about our stay had this not been the case. Prior to arrival I told the hotel we were there to celebrate a special occasion. Via email, they promised to hold a room with a balcony for us. Upon arrival, no such room was waiting, and when I showed the email they said we were out of luck. This was a disappointment. The room was stifling hot, even with the window open it was not much better - and we are from Hawaii and used to hot weather! There were no fans offered and no AC in the room. I realize this is not unusual for European hotels, we just weren't expecting the heat. The room was small and basic. The impression I had from the hotel's website was that it was a classier place, in person it seemed like a basic hotel making an attempt to be classy. Location was fairly convenient, 10 minute walk from the train station and a decent italian restaurant nearby (if you like Italian). But, we would probably try another hotel with more charm next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: gcjambo
Reviews.Content: got a great rate for this hotel through expedia, and the hotel looks exactly how it looks on the website, modern and clean. only a couple of small issues, the were doing some painting whilst we were staying and they had a sheet down in the corridor to our room which i nearly tripped on a couple of times and the walls in the hotel were thin and you could hear people and housekeepers conversations in the corridor. however the positives definately outweighed the negatives. the hotel was nice and central but on a quiet street, rooms were exceptionally clean and the bathroom were an ok size but the showers were a great size. would return and will recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: billeys
Reviews.Content: A good experience and it's cheap too. Room are just as shown in the hotel website or here. PROS - close to U-bahn and it is jsut 2 stops from Zoologischer - clean and bright room - cheap (I paid 49EUR for a single) CONS - walls are a little thin, but I had no problem as most guest are pretty considerate. Also, most are probably out all night. - room and shower is small, but it is pretty standard for Europe It's supposed to be a budget hotel, but its very nicely done and doesn't feel like a budget hotel. I'd defiantely stay here again when I come to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tp1977Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in March 2008 with my boyfriend and another couple. What a great find, very good price and location was not too far from City Centre at all being on a quiet street was lovely as no noise at night. Hotel looks like it was being renovated but our room was lovely and a great size. Would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Metropolitan Berlin - Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: spidermax
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent traveller and I spent 3 days in Berlin with my 18 year old daughter. The hotel was freshly renovated - at least partly - there were still renovations going on when we were there, but they did not disturb us in the morning or at night. They gave me a double room (normally for 59 EUR) for the price of a single room (here: 49 EUR) - Nr. 416, which was really great. Stylish, freshly renovated, new bathroom, both old and new details, with a nice and spacious balcony, and quiet. I can absolutely recommend it! Would be perfect for a couple! The way to the room was a bit funny and like a walk through a labyrinth, however, but that doesn´t matter if you are not a handicapped person (who would have problems, indeed). The staff was very friendly and helpful even after I had complained about the other room (the one for my daughter) which was on the ground floor in the rear building, with the door/window directly at the parking lot (room 015, don´t take it!). During the night she would not open the window or dare to withdraw the curtain. Moreover, the tiny room was filled with green neon light from outside which is not something you´d like to have at night. After our complaint they gave us single room Nr.415, directly beside my room - and this one was very nice, too. Breakfast was extra (6,50 EUR) and was served at the Bistro next door. It was definitely OK for the price and I missed nothing. I have to say that I spent nights in hotels for three times the price - without any better accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Gugu_85
Reviews.Content: Been this hotel in June 08. It is a very stylish and modern hotel and greets you with a very warm and welcoming atmosphere... Also a very clean hotel! Most of staff at reception speaks good english and was very helpful. The only drawback was that we had to go up a couple of steps to reach our room as lift stopped at intermediate floor. Rooms quite stylish as well and beds quite comfy and clean. Overall it was a very good hotel, very close, [like a 15minute walk], to ku'damn, which means close to shops and restaurants; 3minute walk to a train station. A very good standard for its price!! [Though would not recommend it to disabled. ] Ingeneral, I would definitely recommend it to those who need a place to stay while exploring the city during most of the day . I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: ally7770
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with my partner for three nights at beginning of March. Location is pretty good, just a 5 minute walk from the Kurfürstendamm with plenty of restaurants, bars and cafes nearby and a 10 minute walk from the main gay scene. Hotel itself is on a mainly residential street but there is currently building work going on opposite - there was no work going on Sunday morning or Monday morning when we stayed but was quite noisy on Tuesday morning - probably best to ask for a room at the rear of the hotel if you prefer to sleep late. The rooms was obviously recently refurbished (appears to be an old building but freshly done up) and reasonably spacious with comfortable bed, flat screen TV and clean, bright shower-room. Hot water seemed plentiful, unlike in other reviews, even when up reasonably early. Only gripe can mention is the lack of tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Berlin for both value and location.

Reviews.Title: “Good accommodation for the price”
Reviews.Author: standish77
Reviews.Content: For 39 Euros an en-suite room a night...the Metropolitan Hansa Hotel is a great bargain. The location is also very good (only a couple of stops away from the Zoo Banhoff). It is situated in a quiet street near a kebab shop (if you get the munchies later!). We decided on this 3-star hotel...as it didn't work out much more than it would if we had roughed it in a hostel (with a shared bathroom). Unfortunately, at the moment there is building work happening right outside the hotel and the builders tend to start work early around 7am. So do expect some disruption. This also meant that the view out of the window was not exactly a picture postcard. The hotel is pretty clean and the receptionists are efficient and friendly. There is internet connection. Though they charge 2 Euros an hour and you cant get it any cheaper if you want to go online for less time. Breakfast is available in the clean and modern bistro (complete with white retro chairs). Breakfast consists of a buffet of cold food (salads, meat, bread)...and is an extra 6.50 Euros per person. We had it for the first day...and made sure that we piled our plate with as much as possible. Though some old German woman kept giving us deathstares as if to say how disgusted she was that we had so much. I say...for that price you want to try and get as much as possible!!! The buffet is not that sumptious...and if you want anything hot (e.g. scramble eggs, etc) you have to pay extra for it. It's better to eat elsewhere. The double room was large (though the matteresses were actually 2 single ones joined together). The bathroom was clean (and unlike others we DID have hot water throughout our stay). The TV has many cable channels though only CNN and BBC World are in English. One negative aspect was that there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Nevertheless, the overall experience was good...and we would go back again. You really cannot complain as the price is so good for a hotel in a capital city!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price, SUPER Location”
Reviews.Author: diamondroad62
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about a good 10 min walk from Ku'Damm (exit the hotel, make a right, then turn left at the street) and very close to the ZOO. I felt very safe staying in the neighborhood and walking alone during the night hours (before 10 p.m.). I booked room 316 for 39 Euros (Dec 17 - 24), which was a king bed w/balcony. The room was very large and neat ... just like the photos on the website, but the closet was very dusty and the walls could have used a bit of cleaning. The bathroom was very clean and well maintained. My friend booked a single room, which he said was not nearly as nice as my double and extremely small. The hotel staff was friendly for the most part, but wasn't very helpful when it came to accomodating my cold room when the heaters barely worked or cold water in the morning for showers. I stayed at the hotel for seven days and had lots of baggage upon check-out; however, the elevator was broken and I had to carry my two large suitcases down several flghts of stairs. Room 316 was in the back of the hotel and took a good 8 mins to get to from the front desk, which was a maze-like process. FYI: Book a room close to the main door.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of potential, some way to go...”
Reviews.Author: g109
Reviews.Content: Like another reviewer, I stayed here over new year to take advantage of their very advantageous opening offers. The price ranged from EUR59 to EUR29 per night. As others have mentioned the hotel is brand new and offers a boutique atmosphere. It has a good location in the west of the city close to the Ku'damm and the gay bars of Fuggerstr. It certainly had a gay-friendly feel, which is a definite bonus. The rooms are decently sized and the bathrooms are fine. In-room wi-fi is offered at an excellent EUR4 per day. Staff range from very good to extremely surly. The place is however somewhat basic and this gives it more of an insitutional feel, with the lack of small details such as a light switch to turn off the main room lights next to the bed. It feels more like a 2* pension than the 3* hotel it claims to be. The main problem I had, and this is why I have given it 2/5 is something another reviewer alluded to - the hot water situation. I stayed for a total of 3 nights and did not have hot water on any of the mornings, though it did work in the evening. I was obliged to take a cold shower every morning, adding to the institutional feeling. I know for a fact that I was not alone as when I went down to reception, the receptionist was getting very upset when another client could not understand why she had to wait an hour before having her shower because the hotel could not provide her with the hot water she should have been able to expect. I found cleanliness to be an issue. While the room was spotless when I arrived, by the time I left, I was able to write my name on the desk for all the dust that was there. I would certainly consider staying here again if the price were around EUR30-40 but wouldn't pay much more. There are places in Berlin which offer much more with equally good locations in this same price bracket.

Reviews.Title: “A bargain in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: kodot
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights and we were certainly impressed by the hotel itself and the location. Essentially this is a boutique hotel, newly refurbished and kinda chic. The buffet breakfast is a reasonable 7 euros and hits all the right spots. A word of warning however, the hotel has a problem with the hot water supply. This means that if too many people in the hotel have showers at roughly the same time, then for thoswe of us who are late risers there is likely to be only cold water.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel and well situated”
Reviews.Author: Maximar
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we had stayed at the Hotel Wilmersdorf and I would certainly go back there again . It is a 2-star hotel but very clean and has all you need for a short trip. Once again we were able to get a room at a very good price indeed on the web. The staff is always friendly and ready to help. The hotel itself is situated very close to two U-Bahn stations but you can actually walk to the Ku´damm in 10 minutes and there are some good restaurants in the area too (Pariserstr). We were in a smaller room this time and unfortunately the loo-seat in our bathroom was broken. (The cleaning staff would have known this). Even so, for our couple of days stay it was fine and although cold outside, the radiatiors both in the bathroom and bedroom worked well. Whilst perfectly adequate, I seem to remember the breakfast (different rolls, bread, boiled eggs, ham, cheese, salami, cereals, jam honey, juices etc.) being a little more varied on our stay last year (perhaps with yoghurt and fruit available too) but I might be wrong: What I really do remember last year is the fantastic breakfast they laid on for us in the bar at 4:00 am when we had to get an early flight. This year we left at a more civilised time so we didn't need to ask!

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Metropolitan
HotelInfo.Address: Schaperstrasse 36, 10719 Berlin, Germany
